greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Array read by antidiagonals: T(n,k) is the number of k-regular loopless multigraphs on n labeled nodes, n >= 0, k >= 0.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..405
program: my(acc(p, v)=my(z); mapput(M, p, if(mapisdefined(M, p, &z), z+v, v)));

my(recurse(r, h, p, q, v, e) = if(!p, if(ok(x^e+q, r), acc(x^e+q, v)), my(i=poldegree(p), t=pollead(p)); self()(r, limit, p-t*x^i, q+t*x^i, v, e); for(m=1, h-i, for(k=1, min(t, (limit-e)\m), self()(r, if(k==t, limit, i+m-1), p-k*x^i, q+k*x^(i+m), binomial(t, k)*v, e+k*m)))));
for(r=1, n, my(src=Mat(M)); M=Map(); for(i=1, matsize(src)[1], recurse(n-r, limit, src[i, 1], 0, src[i, 2], 0))); Mat(M);
xref: Rows n=4..6 are A000217(n+1), A244868 (with interspersed zeros), A244878.
Columns k=0..3 are A000012, A123023, A002137, A108243 (with interspersed zeros).
Cf. A059441 (graphs), A333157, A333330 (unlabeled nodes), A333467 (with loops).
results.author: _Andrew Howroyd_, Mar 15 2020
